topic_zh: 宇宙的起源：宇宙论证
topic_en: The Origin of the Universe: The Cosmological Argument
core_argument_zh: 凡有开始的事物都有原因。宇宙有一个开始（大爆炸）。因此，宇宙有一个超越时间、空间和物质的原因。这个原因必须是一个有位格的存在——即上帝。卡拉姆宇宙论证（Kalam Cosmological Argument）表明，无限的过去事件回溯在逻辑上是不可能的，因此宇宙必须有一个第一因。
core_argument_en: Whatever begins to exist has a cause. The universe began to exist (Big Bang). Therefore, the universe has a cause that transcends time, space, and matter. This cause must be a personal being — God. The Kalam Cosmological Argument demonstrates that an actually infinite regress of past events is logically impossible, so the universe must have a first cause.

common_objections.objection_zh: 那上帝是谁造的？
common_objections.objection_en: Who made God?
common_objections.response_zh: 这个问题犯了范畴错误。论证说的是“凡有开始的事物都有原因“，而上帝是永恒的、没有开始的存在。上帝是必然存在者（necessary being），不依赖任何外在原因。正如我们不需要问“单身汉的妻子是谁“一样，问“永恒存在者的起因“同样是自相矛盾的。
common_objections.response_en: This commits a category error. The argument states 'whatever begins to exist has a cause.' God, by definition, is an eternal being who never began to exist. God is a necessary being, not contingent on anything external. Just as we don't ask 'Who is the bachelor's wife?', asking for the cause of an eternal being is self-contradictory.

common_objections.objection_zh: 量子力学表明事物可以无因而生。
common_objections.objection_en: Quantum mechanics shows things can come into existence without a cause.
common_objections.response_zh: 量子真空涨落并非“从无中生有“。量子真空本身就是一种物理实在，具有结构和能量。真正的“无“（philosophical nothing）没有任何属性——没有量子场，没有物理定律，没有潜力。从绝对的无中，什么都不可能产生。此外，即使量子事件是非决定性的，它们仍然发生在已有的因果框架之内。
common_objections.response_en: Quantum vacuum fluctuations are not creation from nothing. The quantum vacuum is itself a physical reality with structure and energy. True 'nothing' (philosophical nothing) has no properties — no quantum fields, no physical laws, no potentiality. From absolute nothing, nothing can come. Moreover, even if quantum events are indeterministic, they still occur within an existing causal framework.

common_objections.objection_zh: 也许宇宙是永恒的，循环往复。
common_objections.objection_en: Maybe the universe is eternal, oscillating in cycles.
common_objections.response_zh: 热力学第二定律（熵增定律）表明宇宙的可用能量在不断减少。如果宇宙是永恒的，它早就应该达到热寂（heat death）了。此外，Borde-Guth-Vilenkin定理证明，任何平均膨胀的宇宙都必须有一个过去的时空边界。即使在多元宇宙假说中，这个定理依然成立。
common_objections.response_en: The Second Law of Thermodynamics shows the universe's usable energy is constantly decreasing. If the universe were eternal, it would have reached heat death long ago. Furthermore, the Borde-Guth-Vilenkin theorem proves that any universe which has, on average, been expanding must have a past spacetime boundary. This holds even in multiverse scenarios.

recommended_resources: William Lane Craig, 'Reasonable Faith'
R.C. Sproul, 'Defending Your Faith'
Stephen Meyer, 'Return of the God Hypothesis'

topic_zh: 道德论证：客观道德需要上帝
topic_en: The Moral Argument: Objective Morality Requires God
core_argument_zh: 如果上帝不存在，客观的道德价值和义务就不存在。然而，客观的道德价值和义务确实存在（例如：折磨无辜婴儿取乐是客观错误的）。因此，上帝存在。在无神论的世界观中，道德只能是进化的副产品、社会契约或个人偏好——这些都无法为客观道德提供基础。唯有一位道德完善的上帝才能作为道德的本体论根基。
core_argument_en: If God does not exist, objective moral values and duties do not exist. But objective moral values and duties do exist (e.g., torturing an innocent baby for fun is objectively wrong). Therefore, God exists. On atheism, morality can only be an evolutionary byproduct, a social contract, or personal preference — none of which ground objective morality. Only a morally perfect God can serve as the ontological foundation for moral values.

common_objections.objection_zh: 不信上帝的人也可以行善，道德不需要上帝。
common_objections.objection_en: Atheists can be moral too; morality doesn't require God.
common_objections.response_zh: 道德论证并非说无神论者不能行善——当然可以！论证的要点是道德的本体论基础（ontological grounding），而非道德的认识论（epistemology）。无神论者能够认识和践行道德，但在他们的世界观中，道德缺乏客观的形而上学基础。按照罗马书2:15，上帝的律法刻在每个人心中，所以无神论者行善恰恰证明了上帝的存在。
common_objections.response_en: The moral argument doesn't claim atheists can't be moral — of course they can! The point is about the ontological grounding of morality, not moral epistemology. Atheists can recognize and practice morality, but on their worldview, morality lacks an objective metaphysical foundation. Per Romans 2:15, God's law is written on every heart, so atheists acting morally actually confirms God's existence.

common_objections.objection_zh: 游叙弗伦困境：道德是因为上帝命令才善，还是因为善所以上帝命令？
common_objections.objection_en: Euthyphro Dilemma: Is something good because God commands it, or does God command it because it's good?
common_objections.response_zh: 这是一个虚假的二分法。改革宗神学提供第三个选项：善的根基是上帝自身的本性。上帝不是任意地命令善，也不是服从一个外在的善的标准，而是上帝的本性就是善的终极标准。上帝的命令流出于祂不改变的、圣洁的、公义的、慈爱的本性。善就是与上帝本性一致的。
common_objections.response_en: This is a false dilemma. Reformed theology offers a third option: the Good is grounded in God's own nature. God neither arbitrarily commands good nor conforms to an external standard of good. Rather, God's nature IS the ultimate standard of goodness. God's commands flow from His unchanging, holy, just, and loving nature. The Good is what is consistent with God's nature.

common_objections.objection_zh: 道德是进化的产物，有利于种族存续。
common_objections.objection_en: Morality is a product of evolution, beneficial for species survival.
common_objections.response_zh: 进化只能解释为什么我们有某些道德直觉，但不能说明这些直觉是否客观正确。如果道德只是进化的副产品，那么我们就没有理由相信我们的道德直觉反映了客观真理。这将导致道德反实在论——种族灭绝在客观上并不比利他主义更“错“。但几乎没有人真的接受这种结论，这表明我们深知道德有客观性。
common_objections.response_en: Evolution can only explain why we have certain moral intuitions, but not whether those intuitions are objectively correct. If morality is merely an evolutionary byproduct, we have no reason to trust that our moral intuitions track objective truth. This leads to moral anti-realism — genocide is not objectively more 'wrong' than altruism. But virtually no one actually accepts this conclusion, indicating our deep awareness that morality is objective.

recommended_resources: C.S. Lewis, 'Mere Christianity' (Book I)
R.C. Sproul, 'The Consequences of Ideas'
William Lane Craig, 'On Guard'

topic_zh: 苦难与恶的问题
topic_en: The Problem of Evil and Suffering
core_argument_zh: 苦难问题常被用来反对上帝的存在，但实际上它反而预设了客观道德的存在——而客观道德恰恰需要上帝。改革宗神学认为：（1）上帝有充分的道德理由允许苦难存在；（2）人的有限性使我们无法完全理解上帝的旨意；（3）上帝自己在十字架上进入了人类最深的苦难；（4）上帝应许最终会消除一切苦难和不公（启示录21:4）。
core_argument_en: The problem of evil is often used against God's existence, but it actually presupposes objective morality — which requires God. Reformed theology holds: (1) God has morally sufficient reasons for permitting suffering; (2) Human finitude prevents us from fully grasping God's purposes; (3) God Himself entered the deepest human suffering on the Cross; (4) God promises to ultimately eliminate all suffering and injustice (Revelation 21:4).

common_objections.objection_zh: 一个全善全能的上帝不会允许无辜的孩子受苦。
common_objections.objection_en: An all-good, all-powerful God would not allow innocent children to suffer.
common_objections.response_zh: 这假设了如果上帝有道德上充分的理由，我们一定能知道那些理由。但这个假设是不合理的——一个无限智慧的存在完全可能有超出我们理解的理由。就像一个两岁的孩子不理解打针为什么是好的，我们也可能无法理解上帝允许某些苦难的全部原因。更重要的是，上帝并非旁观者——祂在基督里亲自承受了苦难。
common_objections.response_en: This assumes that if God has morally sufficient reasons, we must be able to identify them. But this assumption is unwarranted — an infinitely wise being may well have reasons beyond our comprehension. Just as a two-year-old cannot understand why a vaccination is good, we may not grasp God's full reasons for permitting certain suffering. Crucially, God is not a bystander — He entered suffering Himself in Christ.

common_objections.objection_zh: 如果上帝有计划，那人的自由意志不就没有意义了？
common_objections.objection_en: If God has a plan, doesn't that make free will meaningless?
common_objections.response_zh: 改革宗神学区分上帝的主权旨意和人的责任。上帝是万事的第一因（first cause），但人作为第二因（secondary causes）仍有真实的选择和责任。约瑟被哥哥们卖到埃及是邪恶的行为，但上帝用它成就了拯救的目的（创世记50:20）。上帝的主权和人的责任并非矛盾，而是圣经启示中的张力性真理。
common_objections.response_en: Reformed theology distinguishes between God's sovereign will and human responsibility. God is the first cause of all things, but humans as secondary causes make real choices and bear real responsibility. Joseph's brothers selling him into Egypt was evil, yet God used it for salvation (Genesis 50:20). God's sovereignty and human responsibility are not contradictory but held in tension in biblical revelation.

common_objections.objection_zh: 世上有太多无意义的苦难（gratuitous evil），不可能都有理由。
common_objections.objection_en: There is too much gratuitous evil in the world; it can't all have a reason.
common_objections.response_zh: 要论证存在“无意义的苦难“（gratuitous evil），你需要证明上帝不可能有我们不知道的理由——但这恰恰是你无法证明的。这被称为“怀疑有神论“（skeptical theism）。此外，基督教独特地提供了苦难的终极答案：不是一个理论，而是一个位格——耶稣基督在十字架上承担了全人类的苦难和罪恶，并在复活中胜过了死亡。
common_objections.response_en: To argue that gratuitous evil exists, you must show God cannot have reasons unknown to us — but this is precisely what you cannot demonstrate. This is known as 'skeptical theism.' Furthermore, Christianity uniquely provides the ultimate answer to suffering: not a theory, but a Person — Jesus Christ bore all human suffering and sin on the Cross, and conquered death in the Resurrection.

recommended_resources: C.S. Lewis, 'The Problem of Pain'
Timothy Keller, 'Walking with God through Pain and Suffering'
D.A. Carson, 'How Long, O Lord?'

topic_zh: 设计论证：宇宙的精细调节
topic_en: The Design Argument: Fine-Tuning of the Universe
core_argument_zh: 宇宙的基本物理常数（如引力常数、强核力、宇宙学常数等）被极其精确地“调节“到允许生命存在的范围内。这些常数中任何一个的微小偏差都会使生命完全不可能。最佳解释是一位智慧的设计者有意设定了这些常数。物理学家罗杰·彭罗斯计算出，宇宙初始低熵状态的概率是10^(10^123)分之一。
core_argument_en: The fundamental physical constants of the universe (gravitational constant, strong nuclear force, cosmological constant, etc.) are exquisitely 'tuned' to permit life. Any slight variation in these constants would make life utterly impossible. The best explanation is an intelligent Designer who intentionally set these constants. Physicist Roger Penrose calculated that the probability of the universe's initial low-entropy state is 1 in 10^(10^123).

common_objections.objection_zh: 多元宇宙假说可以解释精细调节——如果有无穷多个宇宙，总有一个会适合生命。
common_objections.objection_en: The multiverse hypothesis can explain fine-tuning — with infinitely many universes, one will be life-permitting.
common_objections.response_zh: 多元宇宙假说面临严重问题：（1）没有独立的实证证据；（2）它本身需要一个“宇宙生成机制“，而这个机制自身也需要精细调节；（3）根据奥卡姆剃刀，假设无穷多个不可观察的宇宙比假设一位设计者更缺乏简约性；（4）即使多元宇宙存在，仍然需要解释为什么存在能生成宇宙的物理定律。
common_objections.response_en: The multiverse hypothesis faces serious problems: (1) No independent empirical evidence; (2) It requires a 'universe-generating mechanism' that itself needs fine-tuning; (3) By Occam's Razor, positing infinitely many unobservable universes is less parsimonious than positing one Designer; (4) Even if a multiverse exists, we still need to explain why universe-generating physical laws exist at all.

common_objections.objection_zh: 这只是人择原理——如果宇宙不适合生命，我们就不会在这里讨论。
common_objections.objection_en: This is just the anthropic principle — if the universe weren't life-permitting, we wouldn't be here to discuss it.
common_objections.response_zh: 人择原理并不解释精细调节，只是重述了它。类比：如果你面对行刑队，100个枪手全部射偏，你活了下来。“如果他们没射偏我就不会在这里思考“并不能解释为什么他们全部射偏。同样，“如果宇宙不适合生命我们就不会在这里“不能解释为什么宇宙恰好适合生命。精细调节仍然需要解释。
common_objections.response_en: The anthropic principle doesn't explain fine-tuning; it merely restates it. Analogy: You face a firing squad of 100 marksmen who all miss. 'If they hadn't missed, I wouldn't be here thinking about it' doesn't explain WHY they all missed. Similarly, 'If the universe weren't life-permitting, we wouldn't be here' doesn't explain WHY it's life-permitting. Fine-tuning still demands an explanation.

recommended_resources: Robin Collins, 'The Fine-Tuning Argument'
Stephen Meyer, 'Return of the God Hypothesis'
Hugh Ross, 'The Creator and the Cosmos'

topic_zh: 耶稣复活的历史证据
topic_en: Historical Evidence for the Resurrection of Jesus
core_argument_zh: 耶稣复活是基督教信仰的核心，也有强有力的历史证据支持。即使是怀疑派学者也广泛承认以下“最小事实“：（1）耶稣死于十字架；（2）门徒们真诚地相信他们遇见了复活的耶稣；（3）教会迫害者保罗归信；（4）怀疑者雅各归信；（5）空坟墓。这些事实的最佳解释是耶稣确实从死里复活了。
core_argument_en: The resurrection of Jesus is the core of Christian faith, supported by strong historical evidence. Even skeptical scholars widely accept these 'minimal facts': (1) Jesus died by crucifixion; (2) The disciples sincerely believed they encountered the risen Jesus; (3) Church persecutor Paul converted; (4) Skeptic James converted; (5) The empty tomb. The best explanation of these facts is that Jesus actually rose from the dead.

common_objections.objection_zh: 门徒们可能产生了幻觉。
common_objections.objection_en: The disciples may have experienced hallucinations.
common_objections.response_zh: 幻觉理论面临多重困难：（1）幻觉是个人的主观经历，不会在不同时间、地点被不同群体同时经历；（2）保罗和雅各作为非信徒不具备产生“信仰幻觉“的心理前提；（3）幻觉无法解释空坟墓；（4）古代犹太人没有“弥赛亚死而复活“的预期，门徒不会自发产生这种信念；（5）哥林多前书15章记载500多人同时看见复活的基督。
common_objections.response_en: The hallucination theory faces multiple difficulties: (1) Hallucinations are private, subjective experiences — they don't occur simultaneously to different groups at different times and places; (2) Paul and James, as non-believers, lacked the psychological preconditions for 'faith hallucinations'; (3) Hallucinations can't explain the empty tomb; (4) Ancient Jews had no expectation of a dying-and-rising Messiah, so disciples wouldn't spontaneously generate this belief; (5) 1 Corinthians 15 records 500+ people simultaneously seeing the risen Christ.

common_objections.objection_zh: 复活的故事是后来的传说发展，不是历史事实。
common_objections.objection_en: The resurrection story is a later legendary development, not historical fact.
common_objections.response_zh: 保罗在哥林多前书15:3-8引用的信经被学者们追溯到耶稣钉十字架后仅1-5年内形成——这在传说发展的时间框架内根本不可能。目击证人当时还活着，可以被质询。此外，女性被列为首批复活见证人——在第一世纪犹太文化中，女性的证词不被法庭接受。如果是虚构，没有人会选择女性作为首批证人。
common_objections.response_en: The creed Paul cites in 1 Corinthians 15:3-8 is dated by scholars to within 1-5 years of the crucifixion — far too early for legendary development. Eyewitnesses were still alive and could be cross-examined. Moreover, women are listed as the first resurrection witnesses — in first-century Jewish culture, women's testimony was inadmissible in court. If the story were fabricated, no one would choose women as the first witnesses.

common_objections.objection_zh: 复活只是门徒的主观信念，不是客观事实
common_objections.objection_en: The resurrection was merely the disciples' subjective belief, not objective fact
common_objections.response_zh: 门徒的信念需要解释。犹太教中没有单个人在历史终结之前从死里复活的概念，门徒不会自发产生这种信念。他们为这信念付出了生命的代价——人们会为自认为真实的事而死，但不会为明知是谎言的事而死。保罗列出了500多位同时见证复活耶稣的人（哥林多前书15:6），这在当时是可以被验证或否证的宣告。
common_objections.response_en: The disciples' belief demands explanation. Judaism had no concept of an individual resurrection before the end of history; the disciples would not have spontaneously invented this belief. They paid with their lives—people die for what they believe is true, not for what they know is a lie. Paul lists over 500 simultaneous witnesses (1 Cor 15:6), a claim verifiable at the time.

common_objections.objection_zh: 其他宗教也有复活的神话，基督教只是借用
common_objections.objection_en: Other religions have resurrection myths too; Christianity just borrowed them
common_objections.response_zh: 这个论点已被现代学术严重质疑。（1）所谓的'死而复生的神'（如奥西里斯、巴力）实际上是季节循环的神话，与耶稣在具体历史时空中的身体复活完全不同；（2）犹太人极其排斥异教神话，不会从中借用；（3）最早的复活宣告出现在耶稣死后几年内，时间上不允许神话化过程。
common_objections.response_en: This argument has been seriously challenged by modern scholarship. (1) So-called 'dying-and-rising gods' (Osiris, Baal) are seasonal cycle myths, fundamentally different from Jesus' bodily resurrection in specific historical time and space; (2) Jews were fiercely opposed to pagan myths and would not borrow from them; (3) The earliest resurrection proclamation appeared within years of Jesus' death, too short for mythologization.

recommended_resources: Gary Habermas, 'The Case for the Resurrection of Jesus'
N.T. Wright, 'The Resurrection of the Son of God'
Lee Strobel, 'The Case for Christ'

topic_zh: 圣经的可靠性：回应伊斯兰的“篡改论“
topic_en: Biblical Reliability: Responding to the Islamic Corruption Charge (Tahrif)
core_argument_zh: 穆斯林常声称圣经（Injil/Torah）已被篡改（Tahrif），但这与古兰经自身的教导矛盾。古兰经多次确认之前经典的权威性（5:46-47, 10:94, 3:3-4），命令穆斯林参考之前的经文。如果圣经已被篡改，那么古兰经确认一部被篡改的经文，就动摇了古兰经自身的可靠性。此外，数千份圣经手稿（死海古卷等）证明经文传承的准确性。
core_argument_en: Muslims often claim the Bible (Injil/Torah) has been corrupted (Tahrif), but this contradicts the Quran's own teaching. The Quran repeatedly affirms the authority of previous scriptures (5:46-47, 10:94, 3:3-4), commanding Muslims to consult them. If the Bible was corrupted, then the Quran affirming a corrupted text undermines its own reliability. Furthermore, thousands of biblical manuscripts (Dead Sea Scrolls, etc.) demonstrate the accuracy of textual transmission.

common_objections.objection_zh: 古兰经说的是意思被篡改（Tahrif al-Ma'na），不是文本被改变。
common_objections.objection_en: The Quran refers to corruption of meaning (Tahrif al-Ma'na), not textual alteration.
common_objections.response_zh: 即使只是“意思的篡改“，古兰经仍然命令穆斯林去参考“手中的经文“（5:68, 10:94），这意味着文本本身仍然是可靠的。此外，如果我们接受文本完好但意思被误解，那唯一的解决办法就是回去阅读文本本身——这恰恰是基督徒在做的事。当穆斯林读了圣经原文，他们会发现耶稣的神性、十字架的救赎、三位一体等核心教义贯穿始终。
common_objections.response_en: Even if only 'meaning corruption,' the Quran still commands Muslims to consult 'the Scripture in their hands' (5:68, 10:94), implying the text itself remains reliable. If we accept the text is intact but meaning is misunderstood, the solution is to read the text itself — which is exactly what Christians do. When Muslims read the biblical text, they find the deity of Christ, the atonement of the Cross, and the Trinity taught throughout.

common_objections.objection_zh: 圣经有不同的版本和手稿差异，怎么能说没被改？
common_objections.objection_en: The Bible has different versions and manuscript variants — how can it be uncorrupted?
common_objections.response_zh: 手稿差异恰恰证明了文本批判学的成功，而非圣经的失败。我们拥有超过5,800份新约希腊文手稿，加上数万份译本和教父引用。绝大多数差异是拼写和抄写错误，不影响任何教义。通过比较这些手稿，学者可以高度精确地还原原文。相比之下，古兰经的乌斯曼标准化过程中，哈里发奥斯曼下令烧毁了所有其他版本。
common_objections.response_en: Manuscript variants actually demonstrate the success of textual criticism, not the Bible's failure. We possess over 5,800 Greek NT manuscripts, plus tens of thousands of translations and patristic citations. The vast majority of variants are spelling and scribal errors affecting no doctrine. By comparing manuscripts, scholars can reconstruct the original with high accuracy. By contrast, during the Uthmanic standardization of the Quran, Caliph Uthman ordered all other versions burned.

recommended_resources: James White, 'What Every Christian Needs to Know About the Qur'an'
Norman Geisler, 'Answering Islam'
David Wood, 'Answering-Islam.org'

topic_zh: 耶稣的神性：回应伊斯兰对三位一体的误解
topic_en: The Deity of Christ: Answering Islamic Misunderstandings of the Trinity
core_argument_zh: 伊斯兰教否认耶稣的神性，认为三位一体是多神论（shirk）。但古兰经对三位一体的描述（5:116——“安拉、耶稣、马利亚“）是对基督教信仰的误解。基督教的三位一体是：一位上帝，三个位格（圣父、圣子、圣灵），不是三个神。耶稣在圣经中接受敬拜（马太福音28:9），宣告自己与父同等（约翰福音10:30），拥有上帝的属性（歌罗西书1:15-20）。
core_argument_en: Islam denies the deity of Jesus, calling the Trinity polytheism (shirk). But the Quran's depiction of the Trinity (5:116 — 'Allah, Jesus, Mary') is a misrepresentation of Christian belief. The Christian Trinity is: one God, three Persons (Father, Son, Holy Spirit) — not three gods. Jesus in Scripture receives worship (Matthew 28:9), declares equality with the Father (John 10:30), and possesses divine attributes (Colossians 1:15-20).

common_objections.objection_zh: 耶稣自己从未说“我是上帝“。
common_objections.objection_en: Jesus never said 'I am God.'
common_objections.response_zh: 耶稣以第一世纪犹太人能理解的方式宣告了祂的神性：（1）使用“I AM“（ego eimi）自称，直接引用出埃及记3:14上帝的圣名（约翰福音8:58）；（2）宣告赦罪的权柄——只有上帝能赦罪（马可福音2:5-7）；（3）宣称自己是安息日的主（马可福音2:28）；（4）接受“我的主、我的上帝“的敬拜（约翰福音20:28）。犹太领袖正是因为这些宣告要将祂治死（约翰福音5:18）。
common_objections.response_en: Jesus declared His deity in ways first-century Jews understood: (1) Using 'I AM' (ego eimi), directly referencing God's name in Exodus 3:14 (John 8:58); (2) Claiming authority to forgive sins — which only God can do (Mark 2:5-7); (3) Declaring Himself Lord of the Sabbath (Mark 2:28); (4) Accepting worship as 'My Lord and my God' (John 20:28). The Jewish leaders sought to kill Him precisely for these claims (John 5:18).

common_objections.objection_zh: 三位一体不合逻辑——1+1+1=3，不是1。
common_objections.objection_en: The Trinity is illogical — 1+1+1=3, not 1.
common_objections.response_zh: 这误解了三位一体的含义。基督教并非说三个神等于一个神（那确实矛盾）。而是说：一个神的本质（being/essence），存在于三个位格（persons）中。本质和位格是不同的范畴。数学类比应该是1x1x1=1，而非1+1+1。更准确地说，三位一体超越了简单的数学类比——它反映了上帝本体中的关系性存在，这是一神论中独特的深度。
common_objections.response_en: This misunderstands the Trinity. Christianity doesn't claim three Gods equal one God (that would be contradictory). Rather: one divine essence (being) exists in three Persons. Essence and person are different categories. The mathematical analogy should be 1×1×1=1, not 1+1+1. More precisely, the Trinity transcends simple mathematical analogies — it reflects relational existence within God's being, a unique depth within monotheism.

common_objections.objection_zh: 耶稣只是一位先知（nabi），就像穆萨和易卜拉欣一样。
common_objections.objection_en: Jesus was merely a prophet (nabi), like Moses and Abraham.
common_objections.response_zh: 耶稣远超先知的角色。先知说“耶和华如此说“，耶稣说“我告诉你们“（马太福音5:21-22）。先知敬拜上帝，耶稣接受敬拜。先知会死，耶稣从死里复活且有权柄赐人永生（约翰福音11:25）。甚至古兰经也赋予耶稣独特的地位：童贞女所生、行神迹、被称为“上帝的道“（Kalimatullah）和“上帝的灵“（Ruhullah）——这些称号从未给予其他先知。
common_objections.response_en: Jesus far exceeds the role of a prophet. Prophets say 'Thus says the Lord'; Jesus says 'I say to you' (Matthew 5:21-22). Prophets worship God; Jesus receives worship. Prophets die; Jesus rose from the dead and has authority to give eternal life (John 11:25). Even the Quran gives Jesus unique status: virgin-born, miracle-worker, called 'Word of God' (Kalimatullah) and 'Spirit of God' (Ruhullah) — titles never given to any other prophet.

recommended_resources: James White, 'The Forgotten Trinity'
Nabeel Qureshi, 'No God but One: Allah or Jesus?'
Robert Letham, 'The Holy Trinity'

topic_zh: 十字架的救赎：回应伊斯兰对替代赎罪的否认
topic_en: The Atonement of the Cross: Answering Islam's Denial of Substitutionary Atonement
core_argument_zh: 伊斯兰否认耶稣被钉十字架（古兰经4:157），但这与全部早期历史证据矛盾。罗马历史学家塔西佗、犹太历史学家约瑟夫斯都独立记载了耶稣被钉死。更深层的问题是：伊斯兰没有替代赎罪的概念，罪的问题只能靠善行超过恶行来解决。但上帝的公义要求罪必须被审判——基督在十字架上作为代替者承担了我们的刑罚，这才是恩典的福音。
core_argument_en: Islam denies Jesus' crucifixion (Quran 4:157), but this contradicts all early historical evidence. Roman historian Tacitus and Jewish historian Josephus independently record Jesus' death by crucifixion. The deeper issue: Islam has no concept of substitutionary atonement — sin is addressed only by good deeds outweighing bad. But God's justice demands sin be judged — Christ on the Cross bore our punishment as our substitute. This is the Gospel of grace.

common_objections.objection_zh: 古兰经说耶稣没有被钉死——“他们没有杀他，也没有把他钉十字架“（4:157）。
common_objections.objection_en: The Quran says Jesus was not crucified — 'they killed him not, nor crucified him' (4:157).
common_objections.response_zh: 古兰经的这一声明出现在事件发生600多年后，没有任何历史来源支持。相反，所有最早的基督教和非基督教来源（保罗书信、四福音书、塔西佗、约瑟夫斯、犹太法典）都一致记载耶稣死于十字架。历史研究的基本原则是：越接近事件的来源越可靠。第一世纪的多重独立来源远比第七世纪的单一宣称更具历史权威。
common_objections.response_en: The Quran's claim appears 600+ years after the event with no supporting historical sources. By contrast, all earliest Christian and non-Christian sources (Paul's epistles, four Gospels, Tacitus, Josephus, Talmud) unanimously record Jesus' death by crucifixion. A basic principle of historical inquiry: sources closer to the event are more reliable. Multiple independent first-century sources carry far more historical authority than a single seventh-century claim.

common_objections.objection_zh: 上帝不需要牺牲来赦免罪——祂可以直接赦免。
common_objections.objection_en: God doesn't need a sacrifice to forgive sin — He can simply forgive.
common_objections.response_zh: 这低估了上帝公义的严肃性。如果一个法官对严重罪行说“我赦免你，不需要任何代价“，这不是仁慈，而是不公义。上帝既是慈爱的，也是公义的。十字架同时满足了这两个属性：上帝的公义通过刑罚得到满足，上帝的慈爱通过祂自己承受刑罚得以彰显。正如罗马书3:26说，上帝“自己为义，也称信耶稣的人为义“。
common_objections.response_en: This underestimates the seriousness of God's justice. If a judge says to a serious criminal, 'I forgive you, no penalty needed,' that's not mercy — it's injustice. God is both loving and just. The Cross satisfies both attributes simultaneously: God's justice is met through punishment, and God's love is displayed through bearing that punishment Himself. As Romans 3:26 states, God is 'just and the justifier of the one who has faith in Jesus.'

recommended_resources: Nabeel Qureshi, 'Seeking Allah, Finding Jesus'
John Stott, 'The Cross of Christ'
James White, 'What Every Christian Needs to Know About the Qur'an'

topic_zh: 有位格的上帝 vs. 非人格化的终极实在
topic_en: A Personal God vs. Impersonal Ultimate Reality
core_argument_zh: 佛教（尤其是上座部佛教）不承认有位格的创造者上帝，认为终极实在是非人格化的（涅槃/空性）。但一个非人格化的终极实在无法解释：（1）为什么存在具有位格的人类——非位格者不能产生位格；（2）为什么人类有爱、公义、美的深层渴望——这些都指向一位有位格的源头；（3）宇宙的有序性和可理解性——信息和设计需要一个有智慧的心灵。基督教的上帝是三位一体的关系性存在，完美地解释了位格、爱和关系的终极来源。
core_argument_en: Buddhism (especially Theravada) denies a personal Creator God, viewing ultimate reality as impersonal (Nirvana/Sunyata). But an impersonal ultimate reality cannot explain: (1) Why personal beings exist — the impersonal cannot produce the personal; (2) Why humans have deep longings for love, justice, beauty — these point to a personal source; (3) The orderliness and intelligibility of the universe — information and design require an intelligent mind. Christianity's Trinitarian God, as relational being, perfectly explains the ultimate source of personhood, love, and relationship.

common_objections.objection_zh: 佛教不需要“创造者“——因果缘起法足以解释一切。
common_objections.objection_en: Buddhism doesn't need a 'Creator' — dependent origination explains everything.
common_objections.response_zh: 缘起法（pratītyasamutpāda）说明事物相互依存，但无法解释为什么这个相互依存的链条本身存在。这就像说“每一节火车车厢都被前一节拉着“——但整列火车需要一个火车头。无限回溯的因果链在逻辑上是不充分的。此外，缘起法本身就是一个有序的规律——为什么存在这样的规律？规律的存在指向一个规律的设立者。
common_objections.response_en: Dependent origination (pratītyasamutpāda) shows things are interdependent but cannot explain why the chain of interdependence itself exists. It's like saying 'each train car is pulled by the one before it' — but the whole train needs a locomotive. An infinite regress of causes is logically insufficient. Moreover, dependent origination is itself an orderly law — why does such a law exist? The existence of laws points to a Lawgiver.

common_objections.objection_zh: 如果上帝创造了一切，为什么有这么多苦难？佛教至少诚实面对苦难。
common_objections.objection_en: If God created everything, why is there so much suffering? Buddhism at least honestly faces suffering.
common_objections.response_zh: 佛教确实认真对待苦难（四圣谛），这值得尊重。但佛教的解决方案是消除欲望以脱离苦难——最终是消除个体自我（无我/涅槃）。基督教提供了根本不同的答案：苦难不是最终的实在，而是因罪进入世界的扭曲。上帝在基督里进入苦难、胜过苦难，并应许更新一切。基督教不是消除自我来逃避苦难，而是自我被救赎、苦难被战胜。
common_objections.response_en: Buddhism does take suffering seriously (Four Noble Truths), and this deserves respect. But Buddhism's solution is to extinguish desire to escape suffering — ultimately dissolving the individual self (anatta/Nirvana). Christianity offers a fundamentally different answer: suffering is not ultimate reality but a distortion from sin entering the world. God in Christ enters suffering, conquers it, and promises to renew all things. Christianity doesn't dissolve the self to escape suffering but redeems the self and defeats suffering.

recommended_resources: Ravi Zacharias, 'The Lotus and the Cross'
Harold Netland, 'Christianity and Religious Diversity'
Daniel Strange, 'Their Rock Is Not Like Our Rock'

topic_zh: 恩典 vs. 业力：救赎的根本区别
topic_en: Grace vs. Karma: The Fundamental Difference in Salvation
core_argument_zh: 佛教的业力系统（karma）是一个严格的因果报应法则——你的善行和恶行决定你的来世命运。这本质上是一个“功德系统“。但基督教的福音是恩典——不是你做了什么，而是上帝在基督里为你做了什么。以弗所书2:8-9说“你们得救是本乎恩，也因着信；这并不是出于自己，乃是上帝所赐的“。恩典打破了业力的循环：不是靠积累功德，而是靠信靠基督已完成的救赎。
core_argument_en: Buddhism's karma system is a strict law of moral cause-and-effect — your good and bad deeds determine your future destiny. This is essentially a 'merit system.' But the Christian Gospel is grace — not what you have done, but what God has done for you in Christ. Ephesians 2:8-9: 'For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God.' Grace breaks the karmic cycle: salvation comes not through accumulating merit but through trusting Christ's finished work.

common_objections.objection_zh: 业力是公平的——每个人为自己的行为负责。恩典不公平。
common_objections.objection_en: Karma is fair — everyone is responsible for their own actions. Grace seems unfair.
common_objections.response_zh: 如果业力是绝对公平的，那谁能真正达到解脱的标准？业力系统实际上是绝望的——因为没有人能完全消除所有恶业。基督教的恩典不是“不公平“——基督在十字架上承担了公义的审判。代价完全被支付了，只是不是由我们支付。这不是取消公义，而是由上帝自己满足了公义的要求。这是最深的公义与最深的爱的交汇。
common_objections.response_en: If karma is absolute justice, who can truly meet the standard for liberation? The karma system is actually hopeless — no one can completely eliminate all bad karma. Christian grace is not 'unfair' — Christ bore justice's full judgment on the Cross. The price was fully paid, just not by us. This doesn't cancel justice; God Himself satisfies justice's demands. It is the intersection of deepest justice and deepest love.

common_objections.objection_zh: 基督教的恩典会让人随意犯罪——反正都被赦免了。
common_objections.objection_en: Christian grace gives license to sin freely — you're forgiven anyway.
common_objections.response_zh: 保罗在罗马书6:1-2已经回应了这个问题：'我们可以仍在罪中、叫恩典显多吗？断乎不可！'真正经历恩典的人会被恩典改变。一个被从溺水中救出的人不会想跳回水里。恩典不仅赦免罪，还赐予新的生命和渴望圣洁的心（以西结书36:26-27）。改革宗神学强调：得救是唯独因信（sola fide），但真正的信心必然产生善行的果子。
common_objections.response_en: Paul already addresses this in Romans 6:1-2: 'Are we to continue in sin that grace may abound? By no means!' Those who truly experience grace are transformed by it. Someone rescued from drowning doesn't want to jump back in. Grace not only forgives sin but gives new life and a heart that desires holiness (Ezekiel 36:26-27). Reformed theology emphasizes: salvation is by faith alone (sola fide), but true faith necessarily produces the fruit of good works.

common_objections.objection_zh: 业力是公平的，恩典是不公平的
common_objections.objection_en: Karma is fair; grace is unfair
common_objections.response_zh: 如果严格按公平来算，没有人能得到好的结果——因为每个人都犯过错。恩典不是不公平，而是超越公平。在十字架上，公义和怜悯同时得到了满足：基督承担了罪的代价（公义），使我们可以白白得到赦免（怜悯）。真正的问题不是恩典是否公平，而是严格的业力系统是否给人留下了真正的盼望。
common_objections.response_en: If judged strictly by fairness, no one would receive a good outcome—everyone has done wrong. Grace is not unfair but transcends fairness. On the cross, justice and mercy are simultaneously satisfied: Christ bore sin's penalty (justice) so we can freely receive forgiveness (mercy). The real question is not whether grace is fair, but whether a strict karma system leaves room for genuine hope.

recommended_resources: Timothy Keller, 'The Reason for God' (Ch. 12)
R.C. Sproul, 'Grace Unknown'
Jerry Bridges, 'Transforming Grace'

topic_zh: 自我与无我：人的真实身份
topic_en: Self and No-Self: The True Identity of Humanity
core_argument_zh: 佛教的核心教义“无我“（anatta）认为固定不变的自我是幻觉，但这引发了深刻的哲学问题：如果没有自我，谁在修行？谁在轮回？谁在达到涅槃？基督教教导人是按上帝的形象造的（imago Dei），有永恒的价值和身份。自我不是幻觉——你是上帝所爱的、独特的、有永恒命定的位格存在。人的问题不是自我的存在，而是自我的堕落——解决方案是自我的救赎，而非自我的消灭。
core_argument_en: Buddhism's core doctrine of 'no-self' (anatta) holds that a fixed, enduring self is illusion. But this raises deep philosophical questions: If there is no self, who practices? Who is reborn? Who attains Nirvana? Christianity teaches humans are made in God's image (imago Dei), possessing eternal value and identity. The self is not illusion — you are a person loved by God, unique, with an eternal destiny. The problem isn't the existence of the self but its fallenness — the solution is redemption of the self, not its annihilation.

common_objections.objection_zh: 科学也表明“自我“只是大脑的神经活动，没有永恒的灵魂。
common_objections.objection_en: Science also shows the 'self' is just neural activity in the brain — there's no eternal soul.
common_objections.response_zh: 神经科学描述了意识的物质相关物（neural correlates），但相关性不等于因果性或同一性。意识的“硬问题“（hard problem of consciousness）——为什么主观体验存在——至今没有纯物质主义的解释。此外，理性思维、自由意志、道德责任都预设了一个统一的、持续的主体。基督教的灵魂观为这些提供了融贯的解释。
common_objections.response_en: Neuroscience describes neural correlates of consciousness, but correlation is not causation or identity. The 'hard problem of consciousness' — why subjective experience exists — has no purely materialistic explanation. Moreover, rational thought, free will, and moral responsibility all presuppose a unified, enduring subject. The Christian view of the soul provides a coherent account of these realities.

common_objections.objection_zh: 执着于“自我“正是苦难的根源，放下自我才能解脱。
common_objections.objection_en: Attachment to 'self' is the root of suffering; letting go of self brings liberation.
common_objections.response_zh: 基督教同意自我中心（selfishness）是问题的核心——但解决方案不同。耶稣说“若有人要跟从我，就当舍己“（马可福音8:34）。基督教的“舍己“不是消灭自我，而是将自我的中心从自己转向上帝和他人——这恰恰是在爱中找到真正的自我。正如C.S. Lewis所说：“当你完全属于基督的时候，你最终才真正成为你自己。“
common_objections.response_en: Christianity agrees that self-centeredness is the core problem — but offers a different solution. Jesus said, 'If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself' (Mark 8:34). Christian 'self-denial' doesn't annihilate the self but redirects its center from self to God and others — finding the true self in love. As C.S. Lewis wrote: 'The more we let God take us over, the more truly ourselves we become.'

common_objections.objection_zh: 无我并不否认经验主体的存在，只是否认永恒不变的实体
common_objections.objection_en: Anatta doesn't deny an experiencing subject, only a permanent unchanging entity
common_objections.response_zh: 即使区分'经验主体'和'永恒实体'，仍面临困难：（1）谁积累业力并在轮回中承受果报？如果没有持续的自我，业力的因果链就断裂了；（2）涅槃的经验者是谁？如果说'没有人达到涅槃'，这就使修行失去了意义；（3）佛教内部对此也有激烈争论——唯识宗提出了'阿赖耶识'来解决这个问题，实际上是在无我框架中重新引入了某种持续的自我。
common_objections.response_en: Even distinguishing 'experiencing subject' from 'permanent entity' still faces difficulties: (1) Who accumulates karma and bears consequences across rebirths? Without a continuing self, the causal chain of karma breaks; (2) Who experiences nirvana? If 'no one attains nirvana,' practice becomes meaningless; (3) Buddhists themselves debate this fiercely—Yogacara Buddhism introduced 'alaya-vijnana' (storehouse consciousness), effectively reintroducing a continuing self within the no-self framework.

recommended_resources: Ravi Zacharias, 'The Lotus and the Cross'
C.S. Lewis, 'Mere Christianity' (Book IV)
J.P. Moreland, 'The Soul'

topic_zh: 耶和华见证人：耶稣是被造的天使长？
topic_en: Jehovah's Witnesses: Is Jesus a Created Archangel?
core_argument_zh: 耶和华见证人（JW）否认耶稣的神性，教导耶稣是被造的天使长米迦勒。但圣经明确教导：（1）耶稣不是天使——希伯来书1:5-14详细区分基督与天使；（2）万物都是借着祂造的（约翰福音1:3，歌罗西书1:16）——如果祂创造了一切，祂就不可能是被造物；（3）耶稣接受敬拜（马太福音28:9），而天使拒绝敬拜（启示录22:8-9）。JW的《新世界译本》在约翰福音1:1中将“道就是上帝“篡改为“道是一个神“，但这在希腊文文法上是站不住脚的。
core_argument_en: Jehovah's Witnesses (JW) deny Christ's deity, teaching Jesus is the created archangel Michael. But Scripture clearly teaches: (1) Jesus is not an angel — Hebrews 1:5-14 carefully distinguishes Christ from angels; (2) All things were created through Him (John 1:3, Colossians 1:16) — if He created everything, He cannot be a creature; (3) Jesus receives worship (Matthew 28:9), while angels refuse worship (Revelation 22:8-9). The JW 'New World Translation' alters John 1:1 from 'the Word was God' to 'the Word was a god,' which is grammatically indefensible in Greek.

common_objections.objection_zh: 歌罗西书1:15说耶稣是“一切受造物的首生“——说明祂是被造的。
common_objections.objection_en: Colossians 1:15 says Jesus is 'the firstborn of all creation' — so He was created.
common_objections.response_zh: '首生'（prōtotokos）在希腊文和旧约中表示地位和优先权，不表示'第一个被造'。诗篇89:27称大卫为'首生的'，虽然他是耶西最小的儿子。紧接着歌罗西书1:16-17说明了为什么：'因为万有都是靠祂造的...祂在万有之先'。'首生'表示祂拥有对一切受造物的主权和优先地位。如果保罗想说'第一个被造的'，他会用'prōtoktistos'，但他没有。
common_objections.response_en: 'Firstborn' (prōtotokos) in Greek and the OT denotes rank and preeminence, not 'first created.' Psalm 89:27 calls David 'firstborn' though he was Jesse's youngest son. Colossians 1:16-17 immediately explains why: 'For by him all things were created... He is before all things.' 'Firstborn' indicates sovereign preeminence over all creation. Had Paul meant 'first created,' he would have used 'prōtoktistos' — but he didn't.

common_objections.objection_zh: 约翰福音14:28耶稣说“父是比我大的“——说明耶稣不是上帝。
common_objections.objection_en: In John 14:28, Jesus says 'the Father is greater than I' — proving He's not God.
common_objections.response_zh: 这里的'大'（meizon）指的是职能上的关系，不是本质上的差异。在三位一体中，圣子在永恒中自愿顺服圣父（经世关系/economic Trinity），但在本质上与圣父完全同等（本体关系/ontological Trinity）。耶稣在道成肉身的状态下说这话，指的是祂在地上的卑微地位。同一卷福音书中，耶稣也说'我与父原为一'（约翰福音10:30）。经文必须以经文来解释。
common_objections.response_en: The word 'greater' (meizon) refers to functional relationship, not ontological difference. Within the Trinity, the Son voluntarily submits to the Father in the economic Trinity, while being fully equal in essence in the ontological Trinity. Jesus spoke this during His incarnate state, referring to His humbled earthly position. In the same Gospel, Jesus also says 'I and the Father are one' (John 10:30). Scripture must interpret Scripture.

recommended_resources: Ron Rhodes, 'Reasoning from the Scriptures with Jehovah's Witnesses'
James White, 'The Forgotten Trinity'
Walter Martin, 'The Kingdom of the Cults'

topic_zh: 摩门教：另一本经典与另一个福音
topic_en: Mormonism: Another Scripture and Another Gospel
core_argument_zh: 摩门教（后期圣徒教会）在圣经之外加添了《摩尔门经》《教义和圣约》《无价珍珠》作为经典，并教导根本不同的神学：（1）上帝曾是人，人可以成为神；（2）多神论——存在多位神；（3）耶稣和撒旦是灵兄弟；（4）救恩部分靠行为。但加拉太书1:8警告说“若有人传福音给你们，与你们所领受的不同，他就应当被咒诅“。摩门教的“上帝“与圣经启示的上帝是根本不同的存在。
core_argument_en: Mormonism (LDS Church) adds the Book of Mormon, Doctrine & Covenants, and Pearl of Great Price as scripture, teaching fundamentally different theology: (1) God was once a man, and man can become God; (2) Polytheism — multiple gods exist; (3) Jesus and Satan are spirit brothers; (4) Salvation is partly by works. But Galatians 1:8 warns, 'Even if we or an angel from heaven should preach to you a gospel contrary to the one we preached, let him be accursed.' Mormonism's 'God' is fundamentally different from the God of biblical revelation.

common_objections.objection_zh: 摩门教徒生活道德高尚，家庭重视，这不就证明它是好的吗？
common_objections.objection_en: Mormons live moral lives and value family — doesn't that prove it's good?
common_objections.response_zh: 道德生活和家庭价值值得尊重，但真理不是由道德表现来决定的。许多宗教的信徒都生活得很好。核心问题是：这个信仰系统教导的关于上帝、基督和救恩的内容是否为真？耶稣警告说会有人奉祂的名行许多善事，但祂会说“我从来不认识你们“（马太福音7:22-23）。信仰的核心是真理，不仅仅是行为。
common_objections.response_en: Moral living and family values deserve respect, but truth is not determined by moral performance. Adherents of many religions live admirable lives. The core question is: Are this system's teachings about God, Christ, and salvation TRUE? Jesus warned that some will do many good deeds in His name, yet He will say, 'I never knew you' (Matthew 7:22-23). The core of faith is truth, not merely behavior.

common_objections.objection_zh: 我为《摩尔门经》祷告，感到了心中的“燃烧感“，这证明它是真的。
common_objections.objection_en: I prayed about the Book of Mormon and felt a 'burning in the bosom' — this confirms it's true.
common_objections.response_zh: 主观感受不能作为真理的可靠检验。许多不同宗教的信徒都报告了类似的强烈宗教体验。耶利米书17:9说“人心比万物都诡诈“。真理必须以客观标准来检验——上帝的话语（圣经）。此外，摩尔门经的历史性主张（如古代美洲的大规模文明、战争、马匹、钢铁等）完全没有考古证据支持，这与圣经的大量考古确认形成鲜明对比。
common_objections.response_en: Subjective feelings are not a reliable test for truth. Adherents of many different religions report similar intense spiritual experiences. Jeremiah 17:9 says 'The heart is deceitful above all things.' Truth must be tested by objective standards — God's Word (the Bible). Moreover, the Book of Mormon's historical claims (large ancient American civilizations, battles, horses, steel, etc.) have zero archaeological support, in stark contrast to the Bible's abundant archaeological confirmation.

recommended_resources: Walter Martin, 'The Kingdom of the Cults'
James White, 'Letters to a Mormon Elder'
Bill McKeever, 'Mormonism 101'

topic_zh: 东方闪电/全能神教会：识别异端的标准
topic_en: Eastern Lightning / Church of Almighty God: Standards for Identifying Heresy
core_argument_zh: 东方闪电（全能神教会）是在中国影响广泛的异端，宣称一位中国女性杨向彬是基督第二次道成肉身。这违反了圣经的核心教导：（1）耶稣的再来是从天降临、人人可见的荣耀事件（使徒行传1:11，启示录1:7），不是秘密的再次道成肉身；（2）耶稣警告“若有人对你们说'基督在这里'或'基督在那里'，你们不要信“（马太福音24:23-26）；（3）任何在圣经之外声称拥有新启示的运动都应被警惕（启示录22:18-19）。
core_argument_en: Eastern Lightning (Church of Almighty God) is a widespread heresy in China claiming a Chinese woman, Yang Xiangbin, is Christ's second incarnation. This violates core biblical teaching: (1) Jesus' return will be a visible, glorious, public descent from heaven (Acts 1:11, Revelation 1:7), not a secret re-incarnation; (2) Jesus warned, 'If anyone says to you, "Look, here is the Christ!" or "There he is!" do not believe it' (Matthew 24:23-26); (3) Any movement claiming new revelation beyond Scripture should be viewed with suspicion (Revelation 22:18-19).

common_objections.objection_zh: 上帝是全能的，为什么不能再次道成肉身？
common_objections.objection_en: God is almighty — why can't He incarnate again?
common_objections.response_zh: 问题不是上帝“能不能“，而是祂“说了什么“。希伯来书9:28说基督“一次被献“。希伯来书10:12说祂“献了一次永远的赎罪祭“。基督的道成肉身和赎罪是一次性完成的、完美的、不需要重复的。祂再来的方式已经被清楚启示：驾云降临，众目要看见祂（启示录1:7）。任何与这不符的“基督再来“都是假冒的。
common_objections.response_en: The issue isn't whether God 'can' but what He 'said.' Hebrews 9:28 says Christ was 'offered once.' Hebrews 10:12 says He 'offered for all time a single sacrifice for sins.' Christ's incarnation and atonement were once-for-all, perfect, unrepeatable. The manner of His return is clearly revealed: coming on clouds, every eye will see Him (Revelation 1:7). Any 'second coming' inconsistent with this is counterfeit.

common_objections.objection_zh: 全能神教会的信徒也读圣经、热心传教，和基督教有什么区别？
common_objections.objection_en: Members of CAG also read the Bible and evangelize zealously — what's different from Christianity?
common_objections.response_zh: 撒旦“装作光明的天使“（哥林多后书11:14）。识别异端不看表面的热心，而看核心教义：（1）是否承认圣经是唯一最高权威？（2）是否承认基督的独一性？（3）是否教导唯独因信称义？（4）是否有圣经之外的“新启示“凌驾于圣经之上？全能神教会把《话在肉身显现》置于圣经之上，这是致命的偏离。
common_objections.response_en: Satan 'disguises himself as an angel of light' (2 Corinthians 11:14). Identifying heresy requires examining core doctrine, not surface zeal: (1) Is the Bible the sole supreme authority? (2) Is Christ's uniqueness affirmed? (3) Is justification by faith alone taught? (4) Is there 'new revelation' placed above Scripture? CAG elevates 'The Word Appears in the Flesh' above the Bible — a fatal departure.

recommended_resources: 中国教会异端辨析资料
Walter Martin, 'The Kingdom of the Cults'
Anthony Hoekema, 'The Four Major Cults'

topic_zh: 科学与信仰：冲突还是互补？
topic_en: Science and Faith: Conflict or Complement?
core_argument_zh: 现代世俗主义常假设科学与宗教信仰本质对立，但这是一个历史和哲学上的错误。现代科学恰恰诞生于基督教世界观之中——因为相信一位理性的上帝创造了一个有序的宇宙，所以自然界是可以被理性探索的。科学的方法论自然主义（methodological naturalism）适用于研究自然规律，但无法回答“为什么存在自然规律“这样的终极问题。科学和信仰回答的是不同层面的问题，不是竞争关系。
core_argument_en: Modern secularism often assumes science and religious faith are fundamentally opposed, but this is historically and philosophically incorrect. Modern science was born within a Christian worldview — belief in a rational God who created an orderly universe made nature rationally explorable. Science's methodological naturalism works for studying natural laws but cannot answer ultimate questions like 'Why do natural laws exist?' Science and faith address different levels of questions; they're complementary, not competing.

common_objections.objection_zh: 进化论已经解释了生命的起源，不需要上帝。
common_objections.objection_en: Evolution explains the origin of life; God is unnecessary.
common_objections.response_zh: 进化论解释的是生命的多样性（生物如何从简单变复杂），而非生命的起源（非生命如何变成生命）。生命起源仍是科学中的未解之谜。此外，即使接受进化过程，这并不排除上帝。许多杰出的基督徒科学家（如Francis Collins、Alister McGrath）接受进化机制，同时相信上帝是这一过程的设计者和维持者。进化是“怎样“的问题，创造是“为什么“的问题。
common_objections.response_en: Evolution explains the diversity of life (how organisms became complex), not the origin of life (how non-life became life). The origin of life remains an unsolved mystery in science. Moreover, even accepting evolutionary processes doesn't exclude God. Many eminent Christian scientists (Francis Collins, Alister McGrath) accept evolutionary mechanisms while believing God designed and sustains the process. Evolution addresses 'how'; creation addresses 'why.'

common_objections.objection_zh: 历史上宗教迫害了科学家（如伽利略），证明宗教反对科学。
common_objections.objection_en: Religion historically persecuted scientists (like Galileo), proving religion opposes science.
common_objections.response_zh: 伽利略事件常被过度简化。伽利略本人是虔诚的基督徒，他的许多支持者是教会人士。冲突更多是政治和个人的，而非科学与信仰的本质冲突。更重要的事实是：现代科学的大多数奠基人都是基督徒——牛顿、法拉第、麦克斯韦、巴斯德、开普勒等。他们正是因为信仰一位理性的创造者，才相信自然界有可被发现的规律。
common_objections.response_en: The Galileo affair is often oversimplified. Galileo himself was a devout Christian, and many of his supporters were churchmen. The conflict was more political and personal than an essential conflict between science and faith. More importantly, most founders of modern science were Christians — Newton, Faraday, Maxwell, Pasteur, Kepler, etc. Their belief in a rational Creator gave them confidence that nature had discoverable laws.

common_objections.objection_zh: 奇迹违反自然规律，科学时代不能相信奇迹。
common_objections.objection_en: Miracles violate natural laws; we can't believe in miracles in a scientific age.
common_objections.response_zh: 这混淆了自然规律与形而上学假设。自然规律描述的是在没有外力干预时自然界的正常运作方式。如果存在一位创造了自然规律的上帝，祂当然有能力和权利在特殊情况下作出例外。C.S. Lewis指出：奇迹不是违反自然规律，而是自然规律的创立者加入了一个新的因素。问题的关键不是“奇迹可能吗？“而是“上帝存在吗？“——如果上帝存在，奇迹就完全可能。
common_objections.response_en: This confuses natural laws with metaphysical assumptions. Natural laws describe how nature normally operates without outside intervention. If a God who created natural laws exists, He certainly has the ability and right to make exceptions. C.S. Lewis noted: miracles aren't violations of natural law but the Lawgiver introducing a new factor. The key question isn't 'Are miracles possible?' but 'Does God exist?' — if God exists, miracles are entirely possible.

common_objections.objection_zh: 科学已经解释了一切，不需要上帝
common_objections.objection_en: Science has explained everything; we don't need God
common_objections.response_zh: 科学解释的是自然过程的'怎样'（how），而非'为什么'（why）。科学可以描述大爆炸的过程，但无法回答为什么会有大爆炸。方法论自然主义（科学方法排除超自然解释）不等于本体论自然主义（超自然不存在）。许多开创性科学家——牛顿、法拉第、麦克斯韦、普朗克——都是虔诚的信徒。
common_objections.response_en: Science explains the 'how' of natural processes, not the 'why.' It can describe the Big Bang process but cannot answer why there is a Big Bang at all. Methodological naturalism (excluding supernatural in scientific method) does not equal ontological naturalism (the supernatural doesn't exist). Many pioneering scientists—Newton, Faraday, Maxwell, Planck—were devout believers.

common_objections.objection_zh: 进化论已经推翻了创造论
common_objections.objection_en: Evolution has disproved creationism
common_objections.response_zh: 进化论描述的是生物多样性的机制，而非宇宙和生命的终极起源。即使完全接受进化论，仍需要解释：（1）为什么存在一个能产生进化的宇宙？（2）为什么自然规律如此精确地允许生命出现？（3）生命最初如何从无机物中产生？许多严肃的科学家同时接受进化论和上帝的存在。
common_objections.response_en: Evolution describes the mechanism of biodiversity, not the ultimate origin of the universe and life. Even fully accepting evolution, one must still explain: (1) Why does a universe capable of evolution exist? (2) Why are natural laws precisely tuned for life? (3) How did life first arise from non-living matter? Many serious scientists accept both evolution and God's existence.

recommended_resources: Alister McGrath, 'Science and Religion: A New Introduction'
John Lennox, 'God's Undertaker: Has Science Buried God?'
R.C. Sproul, 'Not a Chance'
John Lennox, Can Science Explain Everything? 约翰·列诺克斯《科学能解释一切吗？》
Alister McGrath, Science and Religion 阿利斯特·麦格拉思《科学与宗教》

topic_zh: 宗教多元主义：所有宗教都通向同一个上帝吗？
topic_en: Religious Pluralism: Do All Religions Lead to the Same God?
core_argument_zh: 世俗社会普遍流行“所有宗教都是通向上帝的不同道路“的观点。但这在逻辑上是不可能的，因为各宗教对终极实在的定义互相矛盾：基督教说上帝是三位一体的位格神；伊斯兰说上帝是绝对一位的；佛教不承认位格神；印度教说一切都是梵。这些不可能同时为真。“所有宗教本质相同“的说法实际上是对每种宗教的不尊重——因为它忽视了每种宗教最看重的独特真理主张。耶稣的宣告是排他性的：“我就是道路、真理、生命“（约翰福音14:6）。
core_argument_en: Secular society popularizes the view that 'all religions are different paths to God.' But this is logically impossible because religions' definitions of ultimate reality contradict each other: Christianity says God is a Trinitarian personal being; Islam says God is absolutely one; Buddhism denies a personal god; Hinduism says all is Brahman. These cannot all be true simultaneously. Saying 'all religions are essentially the same' actually disrespects each religion by ignoring its unique truth claims. Jesus' claim is exclusive: 'I am the way, the truth, and the life' (John 14:6).

common_objections.objection_zh: 说只有一种宗教是对的太傲慢了。
common_objections.objection_en: It's arrogant to claim only one religion is true.
common_objections.response_zh: 说别人“傲慢“本身也是一个真理主张——你在主张自己的立场（多元主义）比排他主义更正确。每个人都有真理主张，包括多元主义者。真正的问题不是“谁傲慢“，而是“什么是真的“。此外，如果基督教是真的——上帝亲自来到世上死在十字架上来拯救人——那最傲慢的回应不是相信它，而是对这样伟大的爱说“没必要“。正如Keller所说，认为自己不需要被拯救才是最深的傲慢。
common_objections.response_en: Calling someone 'arrogant' is itself a truth claim — you're asserting your position (pluralism) is more correct than exclusivism. Everyone makes truth claims, including pluralists. The real question isn't 'Who's arrogant?' but 'What's true?' Furthermore, if Christianity is true — God personally came to die on the Cross to save humanity — the most arrogant response isn't believing it but telling such great love 'That's unnecessary.' As Keller notes, thinking you don't need saving is the deepest arrogance.

common_objections.objection_zh: 瞎子摸象的故事不是说明每种宗教只看到了真理的一部分吗？
common_objections.objection_en: Doesn't the parable of the blind men and the elephant show each religion sees only part of the truth?
common_objections.response_zh: 这个类比有一个致命缺陷：讲这个故事的人自认为能看到整头大象——他们自称拥有所有瞎子都没有的全面视角。这恰恰是他们指责排他主义者做的事！此外，基督教的独特之处不是人在摸索上帝，而是上帝主动向人启示自己。不是瞎子在猜大象，而是大象走过来介绍自己。道成肉身意味着上帝不再是我们猜测的对象——祂进入了我们的世界。
common_objections.response_en: This analogy has a fatal flaw: the person telling the story claims to see the whole elephant — claiming a comprehensive perspective none of the blind men have. That's exactly what they accuse exclusivists of doing! Moreover, Christianity's uniqueness isn't humans groping for God but God actively revealing Himself to us. The blind men aren't guessing about the elephant — the elephant walks over and introduces Himself. The Incarnation means God is no longer an object of our speculation — He entered our world.

common_objections.objection_zh: 宗教排他性导致冲突和暴力。
common_objections.objection_en: Religious exclusivism leads to conflict and violence.
common_objections.response_zh: 这混淆了逻辑排他性和行为上的不宽容。相信自己的信仰是真的并不意味着要对持不同信仰的人不好。恰恰相反，耶稣教导我们要爱仇敌（马太福音5:44）。事实上，每种世界观——包括世俗主义——都有排他性真理主张。世俗主义声称宗教排他性是“坏的“——这本身就是一个排他性立场。关键是我们如何对待不同意见的人，而非我们是否持有真理主张。
common_objections.response_en: This confuses logical exclusivity with behavioral intolerance. Believing your faith is true doesn't mean treating people of other faiths badly. On the contrary, Jesus teaches us to love our enemies (Matthew 5:44). In fact, every worldview — including secularism — makes exclusive truth claims. Secularism's claim that religious exclusivism is 'bad' is itself an exclusive position. What matters is how we treat those who disagree, not whether we hold truth claims.

recommended_resources: Timothy Keller, 'The Reason for God' (Ch. 1)
Lesslie Newbigin, 'The Gospel in a Pluralist Society'
Harold Netland, 'Christianity and Religious Diversity'

topic_zh: 基督教是压迫性的吗？——回应社会公义的批评
topic_en: Is Christianity Oppressive? — Responding to Social Justice Critiques
core_argument_zh: 世俗社会常批评基督教是压迫性的——特别在性别、性取向和殖民历史方面。但这种批评忽略了几个关键事实：（1）现代人权和社会公义的概念本身植根于基督教传统——人人按上帝形象被造的信念是平等和尊严的基础；（2）历史上废奴运动、女性教育、医院和大学的建立都由基督徒主导；（3）基督教对权力的批判比任何世俗运动更为彻底——十字架颠覆了一切人类权力结构。
core_argument_en: Secular society often critiques Christianity as oppressive — particularly regarding gender, sexuality, and colonial history. But this critique overlooks key facts: (1) Modern human rights and social justice concepts are rooted in the Christian tradition — the belief that all humans are made in God's image is the foundation of equality and dignity; (2) Historically, the abolition movement, women's education, hospitals, and universities were led by Christians; (3) Christianity's critique of power is more radical than any secular movement — the Cross subverts all human power structures.

common_objections.objection_zh: 基督教历史上有十字军东征、宗教裁判所等暴行。
common_objections.objection_en: Christianity has a history of violence — Crusades, Inquisition, etc.
common_objections.response_zh: 这些暴行确实发生了，基督徒应当诚实承认并忏悔。但这些行为违背了耶稣的教导（“收刀入鞘“，马太福音26:52），不能代表基督教本身。判断一种信仰应该看其核心教导，而非其信徒的失败。此外，20世纪无神论政权（斯大林、毛泽东、波尔布特）造成的死亡远超所有宗教战争的总和。暴力不是宗教的专利——它是人类堕落本性的结果。
common_objections.response_en: These atrocities did happen, and Christians should honestly acknowledge and repent of them. But these acts violated Jesus' teaching ('Put your sword back,' Matthew 26:52) and don't represent Christianity itself. A faith should be judged by its core teachings, not its followers' failures. Furthermore, 20th-century atheist regimes (Stalin, Mao, Pol Pot) caused more deaths than all religious wars combined. Violence isn't unique to religion — it's a consequence of fallen human nature.

common_objections.objection_zh: 基督教对性少数群体（LGBTQ+）的立场是歧视。
common_objections.objection_en: Christianity's position on LGBTQ+ issues is discriminatory.
common_objections.response_zh: 基督教对性伦理的立场来自于对人类整全flourishing的愿景——上帝设计婚姻为一男一女终身之约，是为了人类的好处。这不是出于恐惧或仇恨，而是出于对上帝创造秩序的信念。同时，圣经教导每个人——无论性取向如何——都是按上帝形象造的，拥有不可侵犯的尊严。基督徒被呼召爱每一个人，即使在道德判断上有分歧。真正的爱不是无条件地认同一切，而是忠实地说真话并始终关心对方的好处。
common_objections.response_en: Christianity's sexual ethic comes from a vision of holistic human flourishing — God designed marriage as a lifelong covenant between man and woman for humanity's good. This stems not from fear or hatred but from conviction about God's created order. At the same time, Scripture teaches every person — regardless of sexual orientation — is made in God's image with inviolable dignity. Christians are called to love everyone, even amid moral disagreements. True love isn't unconditional affirmation of everything but faithfully speaking truth while always seeking the other's good.

recommended_resources: Timothy Keller, 'The Reason for God' (Ch. 4)
Rodney Stark, 'The Rise of Christianity'
Tom Holland, 'Dominion: How the Christian Revolution Remade the World'

topic_zh: 意识论证：心灵不能还原为物质
topic_en: The Argument from Consciousness: Mind Cannot Be Reduced to Matter
core_argument_zh: 自然主义认为一切实在都是物质的，但意识经验（qualia）无法用纯物理过程解释。你看到红色时的主观体验、感受疼痛时的内在感觉，这些都不能被还原为神经元的电化学活动。如果宇宙从根本上只是无意识的物质和能量，那么意识的出现就是一个巨大的谜团。有神论提供了更好的解释：一位有位格、有意识的上帝创造了有意识的生命。意识的存在指向宇宙的根基不是盲目的物质，而是有位格的心灵。
core_argument_en: Naturalism holds that all reality is physical, yet conscious experience (qualia) defies explanation in purely physical terms. The subjective experience of seeing red, or the inner sensation of pain, cannot be reduced to electrochemical neural activity. If the universe is fundamentally nothing but unconscious matter and energy, the emergence of consciousness is a profound mystery. Theism offers a superior explanation: a personal, conscious God created conscious beings. The existence of consciousness points to a foundation of reality that is not blind matter, but personal mind.

common_objections.objection_zh: 神经科学最终会解释意识，这只是一个知识差距。
common_objections.objection_en: Neuroscience will eventually explain consciousness; this is just a gap in knowledge.
common_objections.response_zh: 这不是经验性的知识差距，而是范畴性的解释鸿沟。神经科学可以精确描述大脑活动与意识状态之间的相关性，但相关性不等于解释。即使我们完全绘制出每一个神经连接，仍然无法回答为什么物理过程会产生主观体验。哲学家查尔默斯称之为意识的“难问题”（hard problem），它在原则上就不可能通过物理描述来解决。
common_objections.response_en: This is not an empirical gap but a categorical explanatory chasm. Neuroscience can precisely map correlations between brain activity and conscious states, but correlation is not explanation. Even if we fully map every neural connection, we still cannot answer why physical processes produce subjective experience. Philosopher David Chalmers calls this the 'hard problem' of consciousness — it is in principle unsolvable through physical description alone.

common_objections.objection_zh: 意识可能只是大脑复杂性的涌现属性。
common_objections.objection_en: Consciousness may simply be an emergent property of brain complexity.
common_objections.response_zh: “涌现”这个词并没有真正解释任何东西，它只是给问题贴了一个标签。水的流动性可以从分子运动涌现出来，因为我们能看到微观层面如何产生宏观属性。但从完全无意识的物质粒子中涌现出主观体验，这在本体论上是完全不同的跳跃。没有任何已知的物理原理能解释为什么特定的物质排列会产生“感觉像什么”的内在体验。
common_objections.response_en: The word 'emergence' does not actually explain anything — it merely labels the problem. The fluidity of water can emerge from molecular motion because we can trace how micro-level properties produce macro-level features. But the emergence of subjective experience from wholly unconscious material particles is an ontologically different kind of leap. No known physical principle explains why certain material arrangements produce an inner experience of 'what it is like.'

common_objections.objection_zh: 泛心论可以在不需要上帝的情况下解释意识。
common_objections.objection_en: Panpsychism can explain consciousness without God.
common_objections.response_zh: 泛心论（认为一切物质都有某种原始意识）本身就是对纯粹物质主义的放弃——它承认意识不能从纯物质中涌现。但泛心论面临组合问题（combination problem）：微小的原始意识如何组合成统一的人类意识体验？此外，如果意识是宇宙的基本特征，这更符合有神论的世界观——宇宙的根基是心灵而非盲目的物质。
common_objections.response_en: Panpsychism — the view that all matter possesses some primitive consciousness — is itself an abandonment of pure materialism, conceding that consciousness cannot emerge from purely physical stuff. But panpsychism faces the combination problem: how do tiny bits of proto-consciousness combine into unified human conscious experience? Moreover, if consciousness is a fundamental feature of the universe, this fits theism better — the foundation of reality is mind, not blind matter.

recommended_resources: J.P. Moreland, 'The Recalcitrant Imago Dei'
David Chalmers, 'The Conscious Mind'
Alvin Plantinga, 'Against Materialism'

topic_zh: 信息论证：DNA中的信息指向智慧设计
topic_en: The Argument from Information: DNA Points to Intelligent Design
core_argument_zh: DNA分子中包含着高度复杂的指定信息（specified information），类似于计算机代码或人类语言。在我们所有的经验中，复杂的指定信息只有一个已知来源：智慧心灵。自然过程（如随机突变和自然选择）可以筛选和修改已有的信息，但从未被观察到能够从零产生全新的功能性生物信息。生命第一个细胞所需的最低信息量已远超纯粹偶然所能产生的。斯蒂芬·迈尔论证说，智慧设计是生物信息起源的最佳解释。
core_argument_en: DNA molecules contain highly complex specified information, analogous to computer code or human language. In all our experience, complex specified information has only one known source: intelligent mind. Natural processes (random mutation and natural selection) can filter and modify existing information but have never been observed generating novel functional biological information from scratch. The minimum information required for the first living cell far exceeds what chance alone can produce. Stephen Meyer argues that intelligent design is the best explanation for the origin of biological information.

common_objections.objection_zh: 自然选择可以产生信息，不需要设计者。
common_objections.objection_en: Natural selection can generate information without a designer.
common_objections.response_zh: 自然选择只能作用于已经存在的、具有功能的生物体。它可以优化和筛选信息，但不能解释信息的最初起源。生命起源的问题恰恰是：第一个能够自我复制的分子系统（DNA、RNA、蛋白质的协调系统）是如何产生的？在没有自然选择的情况下（因为还没有可复制的生物体），复杂的功能性信息如何从纯化学过程中出现？这是一个自然主义至今无法回答的问题。
common_objections.response_en: Natural selection can only act on already-existing functional organisms. It can optimize and filter information but cannot explain its initial origin. The origin-of-life question is precisely: how did the first self-replicating molecular system (the coordinated DNA-RNA-protein system) arise? Without natural selection (since no replicating organism yet exists), how does complex functional information emerge from pure chemistry? This remains unanswered by naturalism.

common_objections.objection_zh: DNA不是真正的“信息”，这只是一个比喻。
common_objections.objection_en: DNA is not really 'information' — that is just a metaphor.
common_objections.response_zh: DNA确实包含真正的信息，这不仅仅是比喻。信息论的创始人香农定义了信息的数学结构，而DNA完全符合这一定义。更重要的是，DNA中的信息是功能性的指定信息——核苷酸的特定排列指定了蛋白质的氨基酸序列，就像字母的特定排列构成有意义的句子。分子生物学家弗朗西斯·柯林斯称DNA为“上帝的语言”，连发现DNA双螺旋结构的弗朗西斯·克里克也承认生物信息的起源是一个深刻的谜。
common_objections.response_en: DNA genuinely contains information — this is not merely metaphorical. Shannon, the founder of information theory, defined the mathematical structure of information, and DNA fully satisfies this definition. More importantly, DNA contains functional specified information: the specific arrangement of nucleotides specifies the amino acid sequence of proteins, just as specific letter arrangements form meaningful sentences. Molecular biologist Francis Collins called DNA 'the language of God,' and even Francis Crick, co-discoverer of DNA's double helix, acknowledged the origin of biological information as a profound mystery.

recommended_resources: Stephen Meyer, 'Signature in the Cell'
Stephen Meyer, 'Darwin's Doubt'
Michael Behe, 'Darwin's Black Box'

topic_zh: 新约文献的可靠性
topic_en: The Reliability of the New Testament Documents
core_argument_zh: 新约圣经是古代世界中文献证据最充分的著作。我们拥有超过5800份希腊文手稿、10000多份拉丁文手稿，以及大量其他语言的译本和早期教父的引用。最早的手稿片段（如P52）可追溯到公元125年左右，距原作仅数十年。相比之下，凯撒的《高卢战记》最早的手稿距原作约1000年。新约各卷书写成于目击证人仍在世时（公元50-90年代），这使得虚构传说的发展在时间上几乎不可能。
core_argument_en: The New Testament is the best-attested work from the ancient world. We possess over 5,800 Greek manuscripts, more than 10,000 Latin manuscripts, plus numerous translations in other languages and extensive patristic citations. The earliest manuscript fragment (P52) dates to around AD 125, mere decades from the original. By comparison, the earliest manuscript of Caesar's Gallic Wars is about 1,000 years removed. The NT books were written while eyewitnesses were still alive (AD 50s-90s), making legendary development virtually impossible within the timeframe.

common_objections.objection_zh: 手稿之间有成千上万的差异，说明文本不可靠。
common_objections.objection_en: There are hundreds of thousands of variants between manuscripts, proving the text is unreliable.
common_objections.response_zh: 差异的数量大是因为手稿数量庞大——5800多份手稿自然会有大量抄写差异。但关键在于差异的性质：超过99%是拼写差异、词序变化或明显的抄写笔误，不影响任何教义。影响文本意义的差异不到1%，且没有任何基督教核心教义取决于有争议的经文变体。文本批判学的成功恰恰依赖于大量手稿的存在——手稿越多，越能精确还原原文。
common_objections.response_en: The large number of variants is a function of the large number of manuscripts — 5,800+ manuscripts naturally produce many copying differences. But the nature of the variants matters: over 99% are spelling differences, word-order changes, or obvious scribal slips affecting no doctrine. Less than 1% affect textual meaning, and no core Christian doctrine depends on any disputed variant. The success of textual criticism actually depends on having many manuscripts — more manuscripts enable more precise reconstruction of the original.

common_objections.objection_zh: 福音书是匿名的，我们不知道真正的作者是谁。
common_objections.objection_en: The Gospels are anonymous; we don't know who really wrote them.
common_objections.response_zh: 虽然福音书正文没有署名，但早期教会一致且没有争议地将它们归于马太、马可、路加和约翰。帕皮亚（约公元110年）已经提到马可记录了彼得的教导，马太编排了耶稣的话语。没有任何手稿将这些福音书归于其他作者。更重要的是，如果教会要虚构作者，为什么选择马可（非使徒）和路加（非使徒）？他们会选择彼得或安得烈这样的权威使徒。作者归属的一致性表明这些传统是基于历史事实的。
common_objections.response_en: Though the Gospel texts lack author signatures, the early church unanimously and without dispute attributed them to Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John. Papias (c. AD 110) already mentions Mark recording Peter's teaching and Matthew compiling Jesus' sayings. No manuscript attributes these Gospels to other authors. Crucially, if the church were fabricating authorship, why choose Mark (not an apostle) and Luke (not an apostle)? They would have picked authoritative apostles like Peter or Andrew. The consistency of authorial attribution indicates these traditions are historically grounded.

common_objections.objection_zh: 新约经过了多次翻译，原意早就失真了。
common_objections.objection_en: The New Testament has been translated so many times that the original meaning is lost.
common_objections.response_zh: 这是一个常见的误解。现代圣经翻译不是从翻译的翻译而来，而是直接从希腊文和希伯来文原文翻译的。学者们基于数千份原文手稿进行文本批判，建立批判性文本（如NA28/UBS5），然后直接翻译为各种语言。这就像从源头取水，不是从下游的下游取水。任何人都可以学习希腊文来验证翻译的准确性。
common_objections.response_en: This is a common misconception. Modern Bible translations are not translations of translations — they are translated directly from the Greek and Hebrew originals. Scholars perform textual criticism on thousands of original-language manuscripts, establish critical texts (such as NA28/UBS5), then translate directly into various languages. This is like drawing water from the source, not from downstream of downstream. Anyone can learn Greek to verify translation accuracy.

recommended_resources: F.F. Bruce, 'The New Testament Documents: Are They Reliable?'
Craig Blomberg, 'The Historical Reliability of the Gospels'
Daniel Wallace, 'Revisiting the Corruption of the New Testament'

topic_zh: 恶的问题反而证明上帝存在（普兰丁格）
topic_en: The Problem of Evil as Evidence FOR God (Plantinga)
core_argument_zh: 恶的问题通常被用来反对上帝的存在，但仔细分析会发现，恶的存在实际上预设了客观道德标准——而客观道德标准指向上帝。当无神论者说“世界上存在着真正的恶”时，他们在不自觉地借用有神论的资源。在纯粹自然主义的世界观中，自然界没有善恶之分：狮子吃羚羊不是“恶”，地震海啸也不是“恶”，它们只是自然事件。只有在一个由道德完善的上帝所创造、有目的、有意义的宇宙中，“恶”这个概念才真正有意义。普兰丁格的自由意志辩护进一步表明，上帝创造拥有自由意志的存在是可能的善，而自由意志的滥用是恶的来源，上帝允许恶是为了更大的善。
core_argument_en: The problem of evil is typically wielded against God's existence, but careful analysis reveals that evil's existence actually presupposes an objective moral standard — which points to God. When atheists say 'real evil exists in the world,' they unwittingly borrow theistic resources. In a purely naturalistic worldview, nature has no moral dimension: a lion eating a gazelle is not 'evil,' earthquakes are not 'evil' — they are simply natural events. Only in a universe created by a morally perfect God with purpose and meaning does the concept of 'evil' truly make sense. Plantinga's Free Will Defense further shows that God's creation of free beings is a possible good, the misuse of free will is the source of evil, and God permits evil for a greater good.

common_objections.objection_zh: 无神论者不需要上帝也能定义恶——恶就是导致痛苦的事。
common_objections.objection_en: Atheists can define evil without God — evil is simply what causes suffering.
common_objections.response_zh: 将恶等同于痛苦面临严重问题。首先，某些痛苦是善的（如运动后的肌肉酸痛、手术的疼痛）。其次，某些恶不一定直接导致痛苦（如欺骗一个永远不会发现的人）。更根本的是，为什么痛苦在道德上是“不应该”的？在纯自然主义中，痛苦只是神经系统的电信号，没有内在的道德属性。要说“这不应该发生”，你需要一个关于世界“应该”如何的标准——这预设了目的和设计，即有神论。
common_objections.response_en: Equating evil with suffering faces serious problems. First, some suffering is good (muscle soreness after exercise, surgical pain). Second, some evil need not directly cause suffering (deceiving someone who never discovers it). More fundamentally, why is suffering morally 'wrong'? In pure naturalism, pain is merely electrical signals in the nervous system with no intrinsic moral property. To say 'this ought not happen' requires a standard of how the world 'ought' to be — presupposing purpose and design, i.e., theism.

common_objections.objection_zh: 进化可以解释我们的道德直觉，不需要上帝。
common_objections.objection_en: Evolution can explain our moral intuitions without needing God.
common_objections.response_zh: 进化可以解释我们为什么会有某些道德感受，但不能证明这些感受反映了客观真理。如果道德直觉只是进化为了生存而赋予我们的心理倾向，那么我们就没有理由信任这些直觉是客观正确的。这意味着无神论者说“恶真的存在”时，他们没有认识论的基础。进化给了我们相信道德的倾向，但没有给这种信念提供真理保证。唯有上帝才能同时解释道德直觉的存在和它们的客观有效性。
common_objections.response_en: Evolution can explain why we have certain moral feelings but cannot validate those feelings as objectively true. If moral intuitions are merely psychological dispositions evolution gave us for survival, we have no reason to trust them as objectively correct. This means when atheists say 'evil really exists,' they lack epistemological grounding. Evolution gives us the disposition to believe in morality but provides no truth-guarantee for that belief. Only God can simultaneously explain both the existence of moral intuitions and their objective validity.

recommended_resources: Alvin Plantinga, 'God, Freedom, and Evil'
C.S. Lewis, 'Mere Christianity' (Book I)
Greg Bahnsen, 'Always Ready'

topic_zh: 十字架受难：历史确定性对比古兰经的否认
topic_en: The Crucifixion: Historical Certainty vs the Quran's Denial
core_argument_zh: 古兰经4:157声称耶稣没有被钉十字架，而是“有人被变成他的样子替他受死”。然而，耶稣死于十字架刑是古代史上最确定的事实之一。不仅四卷福音书一致记载，而且多位非基督教的古代史家也独立证实：犹太史家约瑟夫（约公元93年）、罗马史家塔西佗（约公元116年）、甚至犹太拉比传统（塔木德）都提到耶稣被处死。即使是最怀疑的批判学者也不否认耶稣被钉十字架的历史性。古兰经写成于事件发生后约600年，却否认一个被同时代多方来源确认的历史事实，这严重损害了它的可信度。
core_argument_en: Quran 4:157 claims Jesus was not crucified but someone was made to resemble him. Yet Jesus' death by crucifixion is one of the most certain facts of ancient history. Not only do all four Gospels record it consistently, but multiple non-Christian ancient sources independently confirm it: Jewish historian Josephus (c. AD 93), Roman historian Tacitus (c. AD 116), and even the Jewish rabbinic tradition (Talmud) mention Jesus' execution. Even the most skeptical critical scholars do not deny the historicity of the crucifixion. The Quran, written about 600 years after the event, denies a historical fact confirmed by multiple contemporary sources, seriously undermining its credibility.

common_objections.objection_zh: 也许是犹大或其他人被变成耶稣的样子替他受死。
common_objections.objection_en: Perhaps Judas or someone else was made to look like Jesus and died in his place.
common_objections.response_zh: 替身理论面临无法克服的困难：（1）耶稣的母亲马利亚和亲密门徒就在十字架下，他们不可能认不出自己的儿子和老师；（2）罗马士兵是专业的刽子手，处死过无数犯人，不可能在如此重要的处决中弄错对象；（3）如果上帝让一个无辜者替耶稣受死，这是一种欺骗行为，与上帝的公义和诚实本性矛盾；（4）这个理论没有任何早期历史证据支持，是600年后的追溯性声明。
common_objections.response_en: The substitution theory faces insurmountable difficulties: (1) Jesus' mother Mary and close disciples were at the foot of the cross — they could not fail to recognize their own son and teacher; (2) Roman soldiers were professional executioners who had killed countless prisoners and would not mistake the identity in such an important execution; (3) If God let an innocent person die in Jesus' place by deception, this contradicts God's just and truthful nature; (4) This theory has zero early historical evidence — it is a retroactive claim made 600 years later.

common_objections.objection_zh: 古兰经是上帝的启示，所以它比人类历史记载更权威。
common_objections.objection_en: The Quran is God's revelation, so it is more authoritative than human historical records.
common_objections.response_zh: 这是循环论证：用古兰经的权威来证明古兰经的内容，再用古兰经的内容来维护其权威。但古兰经的神圣权威恰恰是需要被证明的。如果古兰经在一个可以被独立验证的历史事实上出错了，这就是一个严重的可信度问题。此外，古兰经自己也声称确认之前的经典（包括福音书），而之前的经典一致见证耶稣被钉十字架。古兰经同时确认和否认同一组文献，这在逻辑上是自相矛盾的。
common_objections.response_en: This is circular reasoning: using the Quran's authority to prove its content, then using its content to maintain its authority. But the Quran's divine authority is precisely what needs to be demonstrated. If the Quran errs on an independently verifiable historical fact, this poses a serious credibility problem. Moreover, the Quran itself claims to confirm previous scriptures (including the Gospels), which unanimously testify to Jesus' crucifixion. The Quran simultaneously confirming and denying the same documents is logically self-contradictory.

recommended_resources: James White, 'What Every Christian Needs to Know About the Qur'an'
John Gilchrist, 'The Quran and the Historical Jesus'
Gary Habermas, 'The Historical Jesus'

topic_zh: 三位一体不是多神论
topic_en: The Trinity: Not Polytheism
core_argument_zh: 穆斯林常指控基督教三位一体是多神论（shirk），但这是基于对三位一体教义的误解。基督教坚定地宣告只有一位上帝（申命记6:4），但这位独一的上帝永恒地以三个位格存在：圣父、圣子、圣灵。三位一体不是三个神，而是一个神圣本质中的三个位格。本质（essence/ousia）和位格（person/hypostasis）是不同的范畴：本质回答“是什么”，位格回答“是谁”。古兰经5:116对三位一体的描述（安拉、耶稣、马利亚）是对基督教信仰的歪曲——没有任何基督教传统教导马利亚是三位一体的一部分。
core_argument_en: Muslims often charge that the Christian Trinity is polytheism (shirk), but this rests on a misunderstanding. Christianity firmly confesses one God (Deuteronomy 6:4), but this one God eternally exists in three Persons: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit. The Trinity is not three gods but three Persons within one divine essence. Essence (ousia) and Person (hypostasis) are different categories: essence answers 'what,' Person answers 'who.' The Quran's description of the Trinity in 5:116 (Allah, Jesus, Mary) is a distortion of Christian faith — no Christian tradition teaches that Mary is part of the Trinity.

common_objections.objection_zh: 1+1+1=3，三个位格就是三个神。
common_objections.objection_en: 1+1+1=3; three Persons equals three Gods.
common_objections.response_zh: 这个数学类比误解了三位一体的本质。三位一体不是三个神相加，而是一个上帝以三种位格方式存在。更准确的类比是1x1x1=1。但最终，没有任何有限的类比能完美描述无限上帝的本性。关键在于理解本质和位格的区别：三个位格共享同一个完整的神圣本质，而不是各自拥有三分之一。这不违反逻辑——如果我们说“一个本质是三个本质”那才是矛盾，但“一个本质存在于三个位格中”不是矛盾。
common_objections.response_en: This mathematical analogy misunderstands the Trinity. The Trinity is not three Gods added together but one God existing in three personal modes. A more accurate analogy is 1x1x1=1. Ultimately, no finite analogy perfectly captures the infinite God's nature. The key is understanding the distinction between essence and person: three Persons share one complete divine essence, not each possessing one-third. This does not violate logic — saying 'one essence is three essences' would be contradictory, but 'one essence exists in three Persons' is not.

common_objections.objection_zh: 耶稣向上帝祈祷，说明他不是上帝。
common_objections.objection_en: Jesus prayed to God, which proves he is not God.
common_objections.response_zh: 耶稣向天父祈祷恰恰证实了三位一体——圣子向圣父祈祷，展示了三位一体内部的位际关系。如果上帝只有一个位格，那么祈祷确实说不通。但如果上帝是三个位格的团契，那么位格之间的交流是完全合理的。此外，耶稣作为道成肉身的上帝，以人性向神性祈祷也是合理的——他有完全的人性和完全的神性。耶稣的祈祷不否认他的神性，反而展示了三一上帝丰富的内在生命。
common_objections.response_en: Jesus praying to the Father actually confirms the Trinity — the Son prays to the Father, demonstrating the interpersonal relationship within the Godhead. If God were only one Person, prayer would indeed be nonsensical. But if God is a fellowship of three Persons, communication between Persons is perfectly logical. Furthermore, Jesus as the incarnate God prayed in his human nature to his divine Father — he possesses full humanity and full deity. Jesus' prayers do not deny his deity but reveal the rich inner life of the triune God.

common_objections.objection_zh: 三位一体是后来的发明，初代教会不相信。
common_objections.objection_en: The Trinity is a later invention; the early church did not believe it.
common_objections.response_zh: 三位一体的术语（如homoousios）确实是后来发展的，但教义本身根植于新约圣经。耶稣命令门徒“奉父、子、圣灵的名”施洗（马太福音28:19——注意是单数的“名”，不是“名们”）。保罗的祝福包含三位一体的结构（哥林多后书13:14）。最早的教父如伊格那丢（公元110年前）和殉道者查斯丁已表达了三位一体的信念。尼西亚会议（325年）不是发明了三位一体，而是在面对异端时以精确的术语定义了教会一直以来的信仰。
common_objections.response_en: Trinitarian terminology (like homoousios) did develop later, but the doctrine itself is rooted in the New Testament. Jesus commanded baptism 'in the name (singular) of the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit' (Matthew 28:19 — note the singular 'name,' not 'names'). Paul's benediction has a trinitarian structure (2 Corinthians 13:14). The earliest church fathers like Ignatius (before AD 110) and Justin Martyr already expressed trinitarian convictions. The Council of Nicaea (325) did not invent the Trinity but defined with precise terminology what the church had always believed, in response to heresy.

recommended_resources: James White, 'The Forgotten Trinity'
Robert Letham, 'The Holy Trinity'
Fred Sanders, 'The Deep Things of God'

topic_zh: 圣经与古兰经中的耶稣：对比
topic_en: Biblical vs Quranic View of Jesus
core_argument_zh: 古兰经和圣经都尊重耶稣，但给出了根本不同的画像。圣经中的耶稣是道成肉身的上帝（约翰福音1:14）、全人类的救赎主（约翰福音3:16）、死在十字架上又复活的主（哥林多前书15:3-4）。古兰经中的尔撒则仅是一位先知，不是神的儿子，没有被钉十字架，也没有复活。关键问题是：哪个记载更可靠？新约写于事件发生后20-60年，由目击者或目击者的同伴撰写。古兰经写于事件发生后约600年，由一个从未到过巴勒斯坦的人撰写。从历史学方法论来说，更接近事件的来源更可靠。
core_argument_en: Both the Quran and the Bible honor Jesus, but paint fundamentally different portraits. The biblical Jesus is God incarnate (John 1:14), Savior of all humanity (John 3:16), who died on the cross and rose again (1 Corinthians 15:3-4). The Quranic Isa is merely a prophet, not the Son of God, was not crucified, and did not rise. The critical question: which account is more reliable? The NT was written 20-60 years after the events by eyewitnesses or their companions. The Quran was written about 600 years after the events by someone who never visited Palestine. By historical methodology, sources closer to events are more reliable.

common_objections.objection_zh: 穆斯林也爱耶稣，古兰经对耶稣的评价很高。
common_objections.objection_en: Muslims also love Jesus; the Quran speaks very highly of him.
common_objections.response_zh: 古兰经确实尊重耶稣为先知，记载了他的童女降生和行神迹。但“尊重”不等于“准确”。如果耶稣确实是上帝的儿子（如他自己所宣称的），那么将他降格为仅仅一位先知不是尊重，而是对他身份的根本否认。这就像有人说“我很尊重林肯——我认为他是加拿大一位优秀的小学教师”。称赞的话不能弥补身份的根本错误。
common_objections.response_en: The Quran does honor Jesus as a prophet and records his virgin birth and miracles. But 'honor' does not equal 'accuracy.' If Jesus truly is the Son of God (as he himself claimed), then reducing him to merely a prophet is not honor but a fundamental denial of his identity. This is like saying 'I deeply respect Lincoln — I consider him an excellent elementary school teacher in Canada.' Complimentary words cannot compensate for a fundamental error about identity.

common_objections.objection_zh: 耶稣的神性是保罗发明的，不是耶稣自己教导的。
common_objections.objection_en: Jesus' deity was invented by Paul, not taught by Jesus himself.
common_objections.response_zh: 这个说法站不住脚。首先，在保罗之前的早期信经（如腓立比书2:6-11、哥林多前书8:6）已经表达了对耶稣神性的信仰——这些信经的形成时间可以追溯到教会最早期。其次，耶稣自己宣称有赦罪的权柄（马可福音2:5-7，犹太人认为只有上帝能赦罪）、接受敬拜（马太福音28:9）、使用上帝的自称“我是”（约翰福音8:58，对应出埃及记3:14）。犹太领袖要杀他恰恰是因为他“将自己当作上帝”（约翰福音5:18, 10:33）。
common_objections.response_en: This claim does not hold. First, pre-Pauline creeds (such as Philippians 2:6-11, 1 Corinthians 8:6) already express faith in Jesus' deity — these creeds date to the earliest period of the church, before Paul's writings. Second, Jesus himself claimed authority to forgive sins (Mark 2:5-7 — Jews believed only God could forgive sins), accepted worship (Matthew 28:9), and used God's self-designation 'I AM' (John 8:58, echoing Exodus 3:14). The Jewish leaders sought to kill him precisely because he 'made himself equal with God' (John 5:18, 10:33).

recommended_resources: James White, 'What Every Christian Needs to Know About the Qur'an'
Nabeel Qureshi, 'Seeking Allah, Finding Jesus'
Norman Geisler & Abdul Saleeb, 'Answering Islam'

topic_zh: 文本完整性：圣经与古兰经的对比
topic_en: Textual Integrity: Bible vs Quran
core_argument_zh: 穆斯林常攻击圣经的文本完整性，同时声称古兰经完全没有变化。但历史事实更加复杂。圣经方面：我们有超过5800份希腊文新约手稿，可以通过文本批判重建原文到极高精度。古兰经方面：第三任哈里发奥斯曼在约公元650年下令编纂标准版本时，命令烧毁所有其他版本。早期穆斯林文献记载了几位圣伴（如伊本·马斯欧德、乌拜·伊本·卡卜）拥有与奥斯曼标准版不同的古兰经版本。2015年伯明翰大学发现的古兰经手稿的碳-14测定可能早于穆罕默德的传统年代，引发了关于古兰经成书过程的新问题。
core_argument_en: Muslims often attack biblical textual integrity while claiming the Quran has remained completely unchanged. But historical facts are more complex. For the Bible: we have over 5,800 Greek NT manuscripts, enabling textual criticism to reconstruct the original with extremely high precision. For the Quran: when the third Caliph Uthman compiled the standard version around AD 650, he ordered all other versions burned. Early Islamic sources record that several Companions (Ibn Masud, Ubayy ibn Kab) possessed Quran versions differing from Uthman's standard. The 2015 Birmingham Quran manuscript's carbon-14 dating potentially predates Muhammad's traditional timeline, raising new questions about the Quran's composition process.

common_objections.objection_zh: 圣经有不同版本（天主教、新教），说明它不统一。
common_objections.objection_en: The Bible has different versions (Catholic, Protestant), proving it is not unified.
common_objections.response_zh: 天主教和新教圣经的区别在于旧约的正典范围（天主教包含次经/旁经），而非文本内容的差异。新约27卷书的内容和文本在所有基督教传统中是完全一致的。这与文本篡改是两回事。正典的范围是教会对哪些书卷具有使徒权威的判断问题，而文本的完整性是关于现有书卷是否准确传承的问题。在文本传承方面，圣经的证据远超古兰经。
common_objections.response_en: The difference between Catholic and Protestant Bibles concerns the OT canon scope (Catholics include deuterocanonical books), not differences in textual content. The 27 NT books are identical in content and text across all Christian traditions. This is entirely different from textual corruption. Canon scope concerns which books carry apostolic authority; textual integrity concerns whether existing books are accurately transmitted. In textual transmission, the Bible's evidence far surpasses the Quran's.

common_objections.objection_zh: 奥斯曼烧毁其他版本是为了统一，不是因为有差异。
common_objections.objection_en: Uthman burned other versions for unification, not because there were differences.
common_objections.response_zh: 如果所有版本完全相同，为什么需要烧毁它们？统一的前提恰恰是存在差异。伊斯兰传统自身记载了这些差异：伊本·马斯欧德（穆罕默德推荐的古兰经权威之一）拒绝接受奥斯曼版本，他的版本少了两章经文。此外，早期伊斯兰文献记载阿伊莎（穆罕默德的妻子）声称某些经文遗失了。我们不是在攻击古兰经，而是指出穆斯林对圣经的批评如果用同样的标准衡量古兰经，问题会更大。
common_objections.response_en: If all versions were identical, why was burning necessary? The very need for unification presupposes differences. Islamic tradition itself records these differences: Ibn Masud (one of Muhammad's recommended Quran authorities) refused to accept Uthman's version — his version lacked two surahs. Moreover, early Islamic sources record Aisha (Muhammad's wife) claiming certain verses were lost. We are not attacking the Quran but pointing out that if Muslims' criticisms of the Bible are applied equally to the Quran, the problems are greater.
